III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been having sexual intercourse with a staff member in
exchange for using the staff member's cell phone.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/03/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed complainant on 05/03/2023, who reported the
information was reported by a worker who works with the youth’s
probation officer. The worker overheard the conversation between
to unknown persons and reported the information to the probation
officer.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker via telephone on
05/04/2023. She reported Youth A is currently struggling due to
her behavior. She has a history of going AWOL and aggressive
behavior. She expressed no concerns regarding staff or the
facility. She said the facility is doing an excellent job providing
care and supervision.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
05/04/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. He denied
having any reports or rumors alleging staff is allowing youths to
use their personal cell phones. He said Youth A is currently
struggling because she wants to leave the facility. She had two
incidents yesterday that required her to be taken to the hospital.
One incident was for being suicidal and one was for attempting to
AWOL and damaging facility vehicles, so the police were called,
and Youth A was again transported to the hospital. He reported
Youth A met with her worker yesterday regarding these
allegations and was upset after the meeting. Youth A later said
that someone is making up lies and said, “I wouldn’t fuck a staff
member.”
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/04/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 15 years old and has been at
the facility for 5 months. Youth A was upset about the allegations
and said that is “disgusting”. Youth A denied using any staff
2

member’s cell phone or having sex with a staff member. She
denied having any knowledge of any youths having an
inappropriate relationship with staff. Youth A reported all the staff
on her wing are very professional and did not express any
concerns for staff. Youth A said she is only allowed phone calls to
people that are on her approved list, which are her aunt and
cousin, and she only uses the facility’s telephone.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 05/04/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care worker and works
on Youth A’s wing. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 14
months. Staff 1 reported he is not aware of any staff member
allowing youths to use their personal cell phone. He said the
facility has a phone for the youths to use and they can only make
calls to specific people on their logs. Youths phone calls are
supervised to ensure the youth does not attempt to contact
anyone else. He has not heard any rumors about a staff member
engaging in inappropriate contact with a youth.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/04/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a direct care worker and has
been working at the facility for 18 months. Staff 2 works on the
wing with Youth A. She said there is usually two or three workers
on the wing with Youth A depending on the number of youths and
supervision. She said she has never heard or witnessed any staff
member allowing the youths to use their cell phone. The facility
has a telephone for the youths to use and the youths can only
make calls to persons on their logs. She further denied witnessing
a staff member being inappropriate with the youths.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 05/24/2023, in collaboration
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a direct care worker and has worked
at the facility for 18 months. Staff 3 denied witnessing or hearing
any staff member allowing youths to use their cell phone in
exchange for sex. She said most of the youths have a history for
sex trafficking, so staff monitor the youths closely to ensure they
are safe.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 05/24/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 5
months and is on Youth A’s wing. Youth B denied witnessing or
hearing rumors regarding staff member allowing youths to use
their cell phone or have inappropriate contact with the youths.
Youth A said they are allowed to use the facility phone at 3 pm to
make calls. She said their phone calls are monitored by staff.
Youth B expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
3

I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 05/24/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the facility for 5
months. Youth C reported she has never witnessed staff have
inappropriate contact with the youths. She said youths can only
use the facility phone to make calls. Youth C said staff do not
allow them to use their cell phones. Youth C expressed no
concerns regarding the facility or staff.
MIC Predisposition conference held on 05/24/2023 with MDHHS
Specialist and Supervisor. No Findings.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s Treatment plan dated 01/19/2023 thru
02/17/2023.
• Youth A’s special plan dated 05/04/2023, due to recent
escalation of behavior for truancy, suicidal ideation, and
self-harm. 1:1 behavioral monitoring observation status
precautionary measure for actively having thoughts of
severely self-harming herself, harming others, and truanting
from campus.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence that
staff is having a sexual relationship with youths in exchange for
using a cell phone. Three youths were interviewed, and they all
denied having inappropriate relationship with staff or witnessing
staff allowing youths to use their personal cell phones. All three
staff interviewed also denied seeing any staff allow youth to use
their cell phone.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
